pr_title: Added names for fields based on strings in class_5315

timeline.bodyText: should we prefer "data version" or "world version" name?
timeline.author: liach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_5315
+	FIELD field_25024 version I
+	FIELD field_25025 lastPlayed J
+	FIELD field_25026 versionName Ljava/lang/String;
+	FIELD field_25027 worldVersion I
+	FIELD field_25028 stable Z
+	METHOD <init> (IJLjava/lang/String;IZ)V
+		ARG 1 version
+		ARG 2 lastPlayed
+		ARG 4 versionName
+		ARG 5 worldVersion
+		ARG 6 stable
+	METHOD method_29022 getVersion ()I
+	METHOD method_29023 fromDynamic (Lcom/mojang/serialization/Dynamic;)Lnet/minecraft/class_5315;
+	METHOD method_29024 getLastPlayed ()J
+	METHOD method_29025 getVersionName ()Ljava/lang/String;
+	METHOD method_29026 getWorldVersion ()I

replies.bodyText: Hmm, what is it called in MinecraftVersion?
replies.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: world_version in version.json, but it is called DataVersion in like persistent data, level.dat, etc, and the community uses "data version" as a convention already. Imo the world_version is not accurate, as it should rather be "save version" if we follow this logic.
replies.author: liach

timeline.bodyText: Might specify this is the version of level.dat
timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText: this is the level.dat format version, not the data version of the save represented by the level.dat
replies.author: liach

timeline.message:
Added names for fields based on strings in class_5315

Seems to store level metadata?
Gave a name, and some renames
